primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God entrusts the transcendent treasure of the Gospel to fragile human 'clay pots' so that the power is recognized as belonging to God and not humans, preventing despair in the face of suffering.

tekstueel_bewijs: This extraordinary power belongs to God
God’s mercy and God’s restorative justice is for all
The Easter God is actively engaged and making a difference

object.identificatie: The Treasure (The Gospel/Transformative Power of Love)
tekstueel_bewijs: the gospel, the good news of God’s transformative power of love
it is, however, God’s preferred arrangement

helper.identificatie: Jesus / The Holy Spirit (implied as 'Life at work')
tekstueel_bewijs: this extraordinary power is invested in Jesus
Life is at work in you

tegenstander.identificatie: Fragility / Death / Circumstance / 'The Power of this Age'
tekstueel_bewijs: clay pots crack and break and leak
always carrying in the body the death of Jesus
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'Death' and 'The Power of this Age,' which require a transcendent power to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church and the retiring pastor (L.P.) acting as faithful containers/witnesses of the treasure.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / L.P.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action of 'not losing heart' is presented as a direct consequence of God's primary action of providing the treasure.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God’s restorative justice is for all
The Easter God is actively engaged
voorbeelden_mens_subject: L.P. has been a faithful clay pot

voorbeelden: it is crucial not to confuse the two
He knows the distinction is important
He knows that there is more going on
power that is beyond all our capacity
extraordinary power of God be seen

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God that compensates for the 'Non-Pouvoir' (Incapacity) of the human clay pot.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Fragility) to S1 (God's Power), specifically navigating through the negation of S2 (Not crushed, not driven to despair).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by maintaining the 'mismatch' rather than removing the fragility.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the 'clay pot' is described as leaking, cracking, and carrying death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. It explicitly denies human capacity (Pouvoir) and attributes all transformative efficacy to God's transcendent power.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: L. P. has shown us how to do that.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: This extraordinary power belongs to God and does not come from us.
always carrying in the body the death of Jesus.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: L.P. is used as an example, but specifically as an example of a 'clay pot' (weakness) rather than a hero of virtue.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Jesus (as the one who enacted God's power)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by stating Paul is a witness because he 'never confused the treasure with the container.'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-sufficiency; hope in the midst of institutional decline.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The metaphor of the clay pot and treasure is consistently applied across Paul, the local church, and the retiring pastor.
spanning_punten: The transition to 'it is easy enough' at the end slightly clashes with the previous emphasis on 'afflicted' and 'struck down'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: carrying in the body the death of Jesus... Life is at work in you.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (Life) provides the 'Pouvoir' that the human Subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; described as 'fragility,' 'death,' and 'loss' that humans cannot control.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God as the Subject of power and humans as the fragile Receivers. This is a classic Grace structure.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters the 'Devoir' (moralism) of the age.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'easy burden' section doesn't diminish the 'heavy opponent' established earlier.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is sufficiently 'heavy' to necessitate a divine Subject.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's power) correctly grounds Ethics (not losing heart/ministry).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject while speaking directly to human fragility.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'clay pot' metaphor's beauty; Greimas shows the pot is a 'Non-Subject' regarding power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains what Paul meant; Greimas shows how the sermon's logic mirrors Paul's actantial structure.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's 'comfort' comes from the Subject-switch (God taking over the 'Pouvoir' role).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper' trap where God is merely a tool for human success.
